intro: Dictyolimon gilesii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Dictyolimon gilesii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
